channel.title: quantum computers on Oliver Schmid
channel.description: Recent content in quantum computers on Oliver Schmid

item.title: Pre-Push Checklist
item.description: Last week I made two commits that broke really obvious things. I was rushing and thought to myself “This is a simple change. Let’s just check it in.” I should have realized that these are every developer’s famous last words… After these two incidents happened so close to each other, I knew I needed a way to remind myself to be more careful. To sanity check my changes for things the Continuous Integration build might miss.

item.title: GTD in Roam
item.description: Update May 6, 2022: Now I’m using Todoist for GTD. Update Oct 21, 2021: I have switched to Nirvana HQ for GTD. Update Nov 14, 2020: After some experimentation I returned to using Trello for GTD. Roam is well suited for learning and deep work, but not for juggling a lot of small actions. In particular, clarifying/organizing tasks on Roam mobile was painful due to its slow startup and text based input.

item.title: Website Updates
item.description: The site broke recently. Somehow Hugo had stopped rendering posts or tags and the homepage looked like it had no content.

item.title: Hugo Pagination
item.description: Inspired by Glenn McComb’s Hugo pagination tutorial I decided to write my own custom pager.

item.title: One Month With The Oura Ring
item.description: I’ve been using the new Oura ring sleep tracker for a little over a month now. It’s exactly the kind of wearable I’m a fan of: invisible, reliable, and focused.

item.title: No, My Cellphone Won't Blow Up Your Gas Station
item.description: I had the strangest encounter this morning. My fianc√©e and I were driving into work together at the ungodly hour of 5am when we stopped at a gas station to fill up the tank.

item.title: 2018 BC Referendum on Electoral Reform
item.description: This November BC voters have the duty and opportunity to vote on how we vote. This is BC’s third referendum on voting reform, and also the one with the most options.
